plain.value: ecFlow is a work flow package that enables users to run a large number of programs (with dependencies on each other and on time) in a controlled environment. It provides reasonable tolerance for hardware and software failures, combined with good restart capabilities.

view.value: ecFlow is a work flow package that enables users to run a large number of programs (with dependencies on each other and on time) in a controlled environment. It provides reasonable tolerance for hardware and software failures, combined with good restart capabilities.

plain.value: A WWRP/THORPEX-WCRP joint research project has been established to improve forecast skill and understanding on the subseasonal to seasonal timescale, and promote its uptake by operational centres and exploitation by the applications community.

view.value: Main space for Software Support framework

plain.value: Space for a collaborative discussion on the status and challenges of the migration from Traditional Alphanumeric Codes (TAC) to BUFR. The aim is to share the information on the status of the BUFR data as seen by the users and to provide feedback to WMO and the producers to improve the usability of the data.

view.value: Space for a collaborative discussion on the status and challenges of the migration from Traditional Alphanumeric Codes (TAC) to BUFR. The aim is to share the information on the status of the BUFR data as seen by the users and to provide feedback to WMO and the producers to improve the usability of the data.

plain.value: The TIGGE dataset consists of ensemble forecast data from ten global NWP centres, starting from October 2006, which has been made available for scientific research. TIGGE was established as a key component of THORPEX: a World Weather Research Programme to accelerate the improvements in the accuracy of 1-day to 2 week high-impact weather forecasts for the benefit of humanity. Although the decade-long THORPEX programme finishes at the end of 2014, TIGGE will continue for a further 5 years, when its future will be reviewed.

view.value: The TIGGE dataset consists of ensemble forecast data from ten global NWP centres, starting from October 2006, which has been made available for scientific research. TIGGE was established as a key component of THORPEX: a World Weather Research Programme to accelerate the improvements in the accuracy of 1-day to 2 week high-impact weather forecasts for the benefit of humanity. Although the decade-long THORPEX programme finishes at the end of 2014, TIGGE will continue for a further 5 years, when its future will be reviewed.

plain.value: TIGGE-LAM is an extension of the THORPEX Interactive Grand Global Ensemble (TIGGE) to include weather forecasts from limited area model (LAM) ensembles.

view.value: TIGGE-LAM is an extension of the THORPEX Interactive Grand Global Ensemble (TIGGE) to include weather forecasts from limited area model (LAM) ensembles.

view.value: Wiki to support training activities

plain.value: Uncertainties in Ensembles of Regional ReAnalysis (UERRA) is a project related to meteorological observations funded under EU - Framework Programme 7. It includes recovery of historical (last century) data, estimating uncertainties in the re-analyses and user friendly data services. It aims to contribute to the future Copernicus climate change service.

view.value: Uncertainties in Ensembles of Regional ReAnalysis (UERRA) is a project related to meteorological observations funded under EU - Framework Programme 7. It includes recovery of historical (last century) data, estimating uncertainties in the re-analyses and user friendly data services. It aims to contribute to the future Copernicus climate change service.

plain.value: The Year Of Polar Prediction (YOPP) is a part of the WMO Polar Prediction Project (PPP). The role of ECMWF is to create and host a data archive of selected meteorological fields from ECMWF IFS model for YOPP purposes.

view.value: The Year Of Polar Prediction (YOPP) is a part of the WMO Polar Prediction Project (PPP). The role of ECMWF is to create and host a data archive of selected meteorological fields from ECMWF IFS model for YOPP purposes.
